docs.snippet: President Trump delivered a lengthy criticism of current immigration policy, accused Democrats of using “chain migration” to get votes and repeated unfounded claims of election fraud.

headline.main: Trump Unleashes Immigration Tirade at Tax Event

docs.snippet: The White House announced on Friday that for the second year in a row, President Trump will skip the White House Correspondents Association Dinner.

headline.main: Trump Will Once Again Skip the White House Correspondents Dinner
headline.print_headline: Trump to Skip Dinner Gala With the Press For 2nd Year

docs.snippet: The president found friendly airwaves on WABC-AM’s “Bernie & Sid in the Morning,” where he said he would shun the gala for the second straight year.

headline.main: Trump to Skip Correspondents’ Dinner. But Talk Radio? He’s In.
headline.print_headline: Trump Will Skip the Correspondents’ Dinner. But Talk Radio? He’s In.

docs.snippet: In West Virginia, President Trump continued his tirade against the United States’ immigration laws and accused Democrats of embracing dangerous policies to win votes.

headline.main: Trump Veers From Tax Script to Blast Democrats on Immigration
headline.print_headline: Trump, Off Script, Blasts Democrats on Immigration

docs.snippet: The White House said Tuesday night that President Trump plans to deploy the National Guard to confront what it called a growing threat of illegal immigrants, drugs and crime from Central America.

headline.main: Trump Plans to Send National Guard to the Mexican Border
headline.print_headline: Trump Foresees  National Guard  Securing Border

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.snippet: President Trump said he would consider tariffs on $100 billion more in Chinese goods in retaliation for Beijing’s plan to set levies on American products.

headline.main: Trump Doubles Down on Potential Trade War With China
headline.print_headline: Trump Escalates Fight With China In Tariff Threat

byline.original: By ANA SWANSON and KEITH BRADSHER

docs.snippet: A few Republicans have suggested that the dismissal of Robert S. Mueller III as special counsel could lead to President Trump’s impeachment, but it is unclear how.

headline.main: Even Republicans Have Used the ‘I’ Word, but Would Firing Mueller Get Trump Impeached?
headline.print_headline: Daunting Obstacles Stand In Path to Impeachment, Even if Mueller Is Fired

docs.snippet: Most of the 1,200 migrants moving through Mexico toward the United States are from Honduras, a country plagued by violence and recent political turmoil.

byline.original: By NEETI UPADHYE and DEBORAH ACOSTA

docs.snippet: Trump’s inability to find legal representation is only the latest sign that elites don’t support him.

headline.main: Why Can’t Trump Find Legal Help?
headline.print_headline: Why Can’t Trump Find Legal Help?

docs.snippet: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.

headline.main: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court
headline.print_headline: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court
